channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-5206] Port HBASE-5155 to 0.92, 0.94, and TRUNK
item.description: This JIRA ports HBASE-5155 (ServerShutDownHandler And Disable/Delete should not happen parallely leading to recreation of regions that were deleted) to 0.92 and TRUNK

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12517736/5206_trunk_1.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 15 new or modified tests.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated -123 warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 159 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.TestHFileOutputFormat
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapred.TestTableMapReduce
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.TestDrainingServer
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.TestImportTsv

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/1146//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/1146//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarnings.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/1146//console

This message is automatically generated.

+      for(HRegionInfo hri : allRegions.keySet()){

+        setEnabledTable(hri);

+      }

Each setEnabledTable() call results in round-trip to zookeeper.
Can we remember the tables we have enabled so that the number of calls to setEnabledTable() is reduced ?

For formatting, please insert space between for and (, between ) and {.

Updated the formatting issues.

Can we remember the tables we have enabled so that the number of calls to setEnabledTable() is reduced ?

Only for the first time to enable the table , we need to go the zookeeper and for all the other calls to check the table enable state , we are caching the states in ZKTable.java.
Please correct me if I am wrong.
Please provide your suggestions/comments.

Patch v2 looks good.
Minor comments:


     // Call to undisableTable does this. TODO: Make a more formal purge table.

-    am.getZKTable().setEnabledTable(Bytes.toString(tableName));

+    am.getZKTable().setDeletedTable(Bytes.toString(tableName));

I don't see undisableTable. Can we remove the comment above ?


+          } else if (!this.zkTable

+              .isEnabledTable(region.getTableNameAsString())) {

+            setEnabledTable(region);

setEnabledTable(HRegionInfo hri) already calls zkTable.isEnabledTable(). It seems we can call setEnabledTable(region) directly above.

+      String errorMsg = "Unable to ensure that the table " + tableName

+          + "will be" + " enabled because of a ZooKeeper issue";

A space should be added between " and will.

Resolving as committed.
See note at the bottom of HBASE-5155. This makes 0.92.x incompatible with 0.94.x?
Interesting, if that is indeed true I am -1 for 0.94

So what do we do here? HBASE-6268 will fix this for 0.92.2.
But we've broken the promise that all versions of 0.92 and 0.94 are compatible with each other.
I suppose the damage is done. Let's do the matching fix 0.92.2.
